intro: Xanthostemon pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to arid environments and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Xanthostemon pubescens is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
